verses.roman:
rāmadāsa--mukhya-śākhā, sakhya-prema-rāśi
ṣolasāṅgera kāṣṭha yei tuli' kaila vaṁśī

synonyms: rāma-dāsa—of the name Rāmadāsa; mukhya-śākhā—chief branch; sakhya-prema-rāśi—full of fraternal love; ṣolasa-aṅgera—of sixteen knots; kāṣṭha—wood; yei—that; tuli'-raising; kaila—made; vāṁśī—flute.
translation: Rāmadāsa, one of the chief branches, was full of fraternal love of Godhead. He made a flute from a stick with sixteen knots.
